intro: Ruta sylvestris, commonly known as common rue, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, evergreen leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with serrated edges, and it produces fruits that are capsules containing numerous seeds. Ruta sylvestris has been used historically for its medicinal properties and as a spice.
